abstract.para: &suse; offers a variety of images of different products, for different use cases, and for all major cloud providers. Learn how to find the right image.

sect1.title: Available images
sect1.para: &suse; offers a variety of images of different products, for different use cases, and for all major cloud providers.

sect1.title: &pint;
sect1.para: Use the drop-down boxes to view images, servers, or both and filter by cloud framework, status, and region. You can also search for strings and adjust the number of results shown per page.

sect2.title: Images
sect2.para: The following columns are shown in the Images view. Please note columns depend on the the cloud frameworks.

listitem.para: Name of the image
Status of the image. Can be one of active, inactive, deprecated, or deleted. For more information, refer to .
Name of the image that replaces another.
ID of the image that replaces another. Only shown for &amazon;, &oracle;, and &alibaba;; images on &google; and µsoft; do not have IDs.
Image publication date
Date the image was deprecated by a newer one. Displayed in the format YYYYMMDD (ISO 8601). Only shown for deprecated or deleted images.
Region of the image.
Enviroment of the image. Only shown for µsoft;.
Unique identifier of the image. While the Name of an image is the same across different regions, the ID is unique.
Uniform Resource Name of an image. While the Name of an image is different across the environments, the URN is the same. Only shown for µsoft;.
Date the image was deleted in the format YYYYMMDD (ISO 8601). Only shown for deleted images.

Link to a detailed changelog that lists image configuration changes, CVE fixes, package version changes, and package changelogs. Image changelogs are only available for images that replace others. For initial images of new product versions, refer to the product's release notes at .

sect2.title: Servers
sect2.para: The following columns are displayed in the Servers view:

listitem.para: Host name of the server. Region servers do not have host names.
IP address of the server.
Region of the server. For optimal performance &suse; provides servers in all regions of a cloud framework.
One of regionserver or smt. Every Region has one regionserver and several smt servers.

sect1.title: Lifecycle of images
sect1.para: In the event of severe security vulnerabilities disclosed through the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures process (CVE), the &suse; public cloud development team will refresh on-demand base images to ensure that new instances launch in a patched state. This is in addition to the updates available through the &suse; maintained update infrastructure.
Information about the effects of CVEs can always be found in the &suse; CVE database.

listitem.para: Active images are on a 3 months rolling refresh cycle.
Inactive images will only get refreshed for critical security updates.
Deprecated images do not get refreshed. Images in the deprecated state have entered the last six months of their life-cycle and are subject to removal at the end of the six months period.
Deleted images are no longer available for new instances.

sect1.para: It is recommended to only use images to launch instances for new deployments.
